sentence.Network_en: In time you'll appreciate the beauty and subtlety of this language.
sentence.Network_cn: 总有一天你会体会到这门语言的优美和微妙之处。

sentence.Network_en: Many of the resulting wines lack the subtlety of the original model.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多如此酿制的葡萄酒都不像最初的葡萄酒那样耐人品味。

sentence.Network_en: They had obviously been hoping to approach the topic with more subtlety.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们显然一直希望能更巧妙地切入这一话题。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French soutilte, from Latin subtilitas, from subtilis 'fine, delicate' (see subtle)

entry.def: Subtleties are very small details or differences which are not obvious.

example.ex: His fascination with the subtleties of human behaviour makes him a good storyteller...
example.tran: 他对人们行为上的细微差别极感兴趣，这使他成了一个很会讲故事的人。

example.ex: When a book goes into translation, all those linguistic subtleties get lost.
example.tran: 当一部书被翻译成另一种语言后，所有那些语言上的精妙之处就都丢失了。

entry.def: Subtlety is the quality of being not immediately obvious or noticeable, and therefore difficult to describe.

example.ex: African dance is vigorous, but full of subtlety, requiring great strength and control...
example.tran: 非洲舞蹈充满活力，但不乏精妙之处，需要舞者有很强的力量和控制能力。

example.ex: Many of the resulting wines lack the subtlety of the original model.
example.tran: 许多如此酿制的葡萄酒都不像最初的葡萄酒那样耐人品味。

entry.def: Subtlety is the ability to notice and recognize things which are not obvious, especially small differences between things.

example.ex: She analyses herself with great subtlety.
example.tran: 她非常敏锐地分析自己。

entry.def: Subtlety is the ability to use indirect methods to achieve something, rather than doing something that is obvious.

example.ex: They had obviously been hoping to approach the topic with more subtlety.
example.tran: 他们显然一直希望能更巧妙地切入这一话题。

means.word_mean: 1. a subtle difference in meaning or opinion or attitude;

sentences.sentence: "without understanding the finer nuances you can't enjoy the humor"

means.word_mean: 2. the quality of being difficult to detect or analyze;

sentences.sentence: "you had to admire the subtlety of the distinctions he drew"

sentences.en: He argued his case with considerable subtlety.
sentences.cn: 他相当机敏地为自己的论点辩护。

sentences.en: I think the translator missed some of the subtleties of the original.
sentences.cn: 我认为译者漏掉了原著中一些微妙之处。
